IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ASSIST PEOPLE WITH EPILEPSY AND TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ABOUT EPILEPSY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: ASSIST PEOPLE WITH EPILEPSY AND TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ABOUT EPILEPSY.
IRS990.Desc: EPILEPSY SERVICESEMPOWERS INDIVIDUALS WITH EPILEPSY AND THEIR FAMILIES TO EDUCATE THEMSELVES AND OTHERS ABOUT EPILEPSY THROUGH TRAININGS AND ADVOCACY.CASH FROM THE SALE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S INVESTMENTS WAS TRANSFERRED TO THE EPILEPSY FOUNDATION OF AMERICA, DESIGNATED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ABILITIES NETWORK, INC. AND EPILEPSY FOUNDATION OF THE CHESAPEAKE REGION, INC. ARE INCORPORATED IN MARYLAND AS NON-PROFIT CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE ORGANIZATIONS FOLLOW THE PROVISIONS OF THE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION, ACCOUNTING FOR INCOME TAXES. THIS TOPIC REQUIRES THE ORGANIZATIONS TO RECOGNIZE OR DISCLOSE ANY TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD RESULT IN UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS. THE ORGANIZATIONS HAVE NO POSITIONS THAT WOULD REQUIRE DISCLOSURE OR RECOGNITION UNDER THE TOPIC. TAX YEARS ENDING AFTER JUNE 30, 2014 ARE STILL OPEN FOR REVIEW BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.
REVENUE OF AFFILIATE INCLUDED IN COMBINED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS 8,159,269. FORGIVEN LOAN INCLUDED AS INCOME IN PART VIII, LINE 1D -77,700.
EXPENSE OF AFFILIATE INCLUDED IN COMBINED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS 7,925,852. FORGIVEN LOAN INCLUDED AS INCOME IN PART VIII, LINE 1D -77,700.

LiquidationOfAssetsDetail.AssetsDistriOrExpnssPaidDesc: TRANSFER OF CASH IN PARTIAL SATISFACTION OF LOAN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXPLANATION OF INVOLVEMENT: ALL OFFICERS/DIRECTORS OF THE FILING ORGANIZATION WERE ALSO OFFICERS/ DIRECTORS OF THE RELATED TRANSFEREE ORGANIZATION PRIOR TO THE TRANSFER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF FORM 990 WILL BE PRESENTED AT AN UPCOMING EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEETING TO ALL EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEMBERS WHO ACT FOR THE ENTIRE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REGULARLY AND CONSISTENTLY MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY BY GOING OVER THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY WITH ALL NEW BOARD MEMBERS AND THE ORGANIZATION IS PLANNING TO IMPLEMENT YEARLY REVIEWS OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY WITH ALL BOARD MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PROCESS FOR DETERMINING COMPENSATION STARTS WITH THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVING NATIONAL SURVEYS FROM A SALARY SERVICE WITH SALARIES FOR VARIOUS POSITIONS FROM COMPARABLE SIZED ORGANIZATIONS. FROM THERE, THE ORGANIZATION REVIEWS ALL COMPENSATION AMOUNTS FOR ALL EMPLOYEES AND TRIES TO ESTABLISH REVISED SALARIES THAT ARE ON AVERAGE, 50% OF THE NATIONAL AVERAGE. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S SALARY IS DETERMINED BY THE EXECUTIVE BOARD AFTER COMPARING CURRENT SALARY TO NATIONAL AVERAGE AND MAKING ADJUSTMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC BY PROVIDING THEM UPON REQUEST TO INDIVIDUALS WHO REQUEST THE INFORMATION.
THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE AUDIT AND PREPARATION OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: CHALLENGE COMMUNITY TO ACKNOWLEDGE VALUE/EQUALITY OF PEOPLE OF ALL ABILITIES
